field_edited_text.value:
TyYPICAL ANALYSIS 111

2—Concentrated Load for moment, based on 18,000* per 9 feet lane,
12

for 12 feet lane: 5 x 18,000% x 949, = 22,600* per truss
3—Concentrated Load for shear, based on 26,000* per 9 feet lane,
for 12 feet lane: % X 26,000% x 949, = 32,600* per truss.
Impact
50 . b
I = 1% in which:

I = Impact fraction
L = the length in feet of the portion of the span which is loaded
to produce the maximum stress in the member considered
Wind—Units “A”” and “B” ‘

A wind load of 30* per square foot on the exposed surface of the
roadway, floor framing, curb and handrail and one and one-half times the
exposed surface of the remaining truss members as seen in elevation.
In addition a load of two hundred pounds per lineal foot applied on
the moving live load, acting at a point six feet above the surface of
the roadway. These loads were assumed to act in a lateral direction
normal to the center line of bridge.

50 per cent of the above specified lateral loads were assumed to act
in the longitudinal direction of the structure.

Traction
10 per cent of the live loads applied to one lane were taken to act in
the longitudinal direction as representative of the load of traction on
the structure, acting at the surface of the road.
Unat Stresses
Tension—24,000* per square inch for structural grade silicon steel.

2
Compression—20,400* per square inch —.583 (—%—) , where % shall not ex-

ceed 120 for main truss members, for structural grade silicon steel.
Unit stresses for other materials in accordance with standard speci-
fications.

Trusses

The weight of the main truss material was estimated on the basis of an
allowance of 40 per cent for details such as pins, gusset plates, splices,
diaphragms, lacing, rivets, etc.
